intro: Eumachia oddonii var. oddonii, commonly known as the Korean yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to South Korea. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, providing ornamental value in gardens. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
